channel.title: PortalS?
channel.description:
ok..hi..i have pimpscape and wen i try to add more then 1 portal to tele me to somewere...i put it on case: 132...how do i create a case for this? : [code]if (objectID == 7289) { teleportToX = 3283; teleportToY = 3883;[/code]
wats the i put for case 7289? [format plz?]
the object already appears
it gives errors: case 95 //update caht ^ on c ad private int junk ^ on p
ty?[br][size=1]Posted on: July 05, 2007, 08:27:45 PM[/size][hr]how do i create a case? like case 7289? were it go? anywere?

item.title: PortalS?
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

It makes it look more professional, when you post a correct case, because there’s no point in wasting even more lines in your client, when most of them are jam-packed. What’s the point of the braces/brackets, if there is no ‘if statement’?

Read full topic

item.title: PortalS?
item.dc:creator: @SWAT SWAT
item.description:
@SWAT wrote:

[quote=“Fr33b1e, post:22, topic:120195”] case 7289: { teleportToX = 3283; teleportToY = 3883; } break;
Your code is wrong, you need no braces/brackets, because you have no if statements, so just make it like this pretty much.

case 7289: teleportToX = 3283; teleportToY = 3883; break;[/quote]

lmao i can better code that you do and i just change it for him and it doesn’t matter if you have case 7289: teleportToX = 3283; teleportToY = 3883; break;
or this

case 7289: { teleportToX = 3283; teleportToY = 3883; } break;

so stfu

Read full topic

item.title: PortalS?
item.dc:creator: @Fr33b1e Fr33b1e
item.description:
@Fr33b1e wrote:

case 7289:
			{
		   teleportToX = 3283;
		   teleportToY = 3883;
}
                break;

Your code is wrong, you need no braces/brackets, because you have no if statements, so just make it like this pretty much.

case 7289: teleportToX = 3283; teleportToY = 3883; break;

Read full topic

item.title: PortalS?
item.dc:creator: @SWAT SWAT
item.description:
@SWAT wrote:

public void name() { if(absX >= ##1## && absX <= ##2## && absY >= ##3## && absY <=##4##) { IsSnowing = 5; } }
##1## = coord X ,If high then coord
##2##= coord X ,If lower then coord
##3## = coord y ,If high that coord
##4##= coord y ,If lower that coord

item.title: PortalS?
item.dc:creator: @SWAT SWAT
item.description:
@SWAT wrote:

yes

change this

public void teleport()

to

public void teleport()
{
teleport = true;
if(ancientstele == true)
{
playerGfx(392, 0);
teletimer = 8;
}
else if(ancientstele == false)
{

playerGfx(308, 0);
teletimer = 5;
}
}

item.title: PortalS?
item.dc:creator: @hanif hanif
item.description:
@hanif wrote:

iM USING MY FRIEND (ELKK) SOURCE! Best source in here, TRUST ME!!!
Open up client.java
Ok on your keyboard hold down CTRL(Control) & F and this popup screen will come up, in the text box add in:

case 823:

and click on search or press Enter in your keyboard now you will see (SOMETHING LIKE THIS)

:
(I got this from my source called Global warming attack v1)

case 823: if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You focus, clear your thoughts & hit the dummy!"); setAnimation(0x326); deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 1000000); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 12; } break;

Now, after

break;

ADD IN YOUR CASE!

So, since you told me that you want the portal to tele you somewhere, I made this for you!:

case 7289:
teleportToX = 3283;
teleportToY = 3883;
}
break;

Now copy that and paste it after break; in case 823!

So it might resemble to this:

[code]case 823:
if (actionTimer == 0) {
sendMessage(“You focus, clear your thoughts & hit the dummy!”);
setAnimation(0x326);
deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 1000000);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[0]), 0);
addSkillXP((150playerLevel[3]), 3);
addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18);
actionTimer = 12;
}
break;

case 7289:
teleportToX = 3283;
teleportToY = 3883;
}
break;[/code]

~Mac

Read full topic
